result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trenton L Canady

records.addlTxt: Defense still in negotiation posture and requested plea and sentencing adjournment. State does not object. Court granted defense's request. Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 16; IN PERSON. Defendant to be produced for the next court date. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Angel L Johnson in court via zoom, defendant Trenton L Canady not in court, in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and a global offer. Further, defense advises they are in a resolution posture. Court schedules next court date for a Plea Hearing and sets 07/26/2022 deadline to file any motions. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Trenton L Canady in court with attorney Colin McGinn appear for Angel L Johnson, appear by video.  Defendant Trenton L Canady in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S. Patrick. Court took Judical Notice to case 18CF5541 & 20CF3209. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

ADDRESS INFO for Trenton L Canady
Current: PO Box 18294, Milwaukee, WI 53218 United States  (Effective: 05-23-2022)
Prior: 8963 W Grantosa Dr, Milwaukee, WI 53225

Defendant Trenton L Canady not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Angel Johnson to be appointed pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Trenton L Canady
Current: 8963 W Grantosa Dr, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 04-27-2022)
Prior: 4933 North 48th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209

Defendant Trenton L Canady in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Trenton L Canady in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Trenton L Canady appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
